alert.note: Alert for Lake Casitas; Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued February 13 at 12:11PM PST until February 15 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 10 PM PST TUESDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, northwest winds 25 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. For the Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low around 32 degrees possible. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast and Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 6 AM to 10 PM PST Tuesday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Tuesday night through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down large objects such as trees and power lines. Power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Plan for extra time to defrost vehicle windshields.
